variant.question: Consider Rescue & Fire Fighting (RFF) services as required by ICAO Annex 14. "Response time" is considered to be the time between the initial call to the RFF service and the time when the first responding vehicle.

options.text: is in position to apply foam.
arrives at the scene of an accident or incident.
is moving under its own power.
is completely manned and ready to respond.

variant.question: What is meant by the term 'response time', regarding rescue and fire fighting (RFF) at an aerodrome?

options.text: The time between the initial call to the rescue and fire fighting service, and the time when the first responding vehicle is in position to apply foam.
The time between the observation of the accident, and the time when the first responding vehicle is approaching the scene of accident.
The time between the initial call to the rescue and fire fighting service, and the time when the first responding vehicle is leaving the station.
The time between the initial call to the rescue and fire fighting service, and the time when the first responding vehicle is approaching the scene of accident.
